title: Meet the speakers! - EUDTP 2025 - EuroTech Universities Alliance
snippet: Fabio Giglietto is listed as a Professor of Internet Studies at University of Urbino Carlo Bo and a speaker at the EUDTP 2025 conference in Brussels. His research on disinformation dynamics and media manipulation is highlighted, noting his work provides insights into identifying and countering harmful information operations. He will be speaking about implementation challenges and opportunities under DSA
description: This webpage announces Fabio Giglietto as a speaker at the EUDTP 2025 conference, highlighting his expertise in disinformation dynamics and media manipulation and his upcoming talk on implementation challenges under the DSA.

title: Advancing Research on Disinformation and Digital Manipulation: The University of Urbino at two Key Conferences in Brazil – vera.ai VERification Assisted by Artificial Intelligence
snippet: Reports on Fabio Giglietto's participation in two conferences in Brazil in October 2025, where he presented research on using large language models to analyze political discourse in hyperpartisan Facebook groups. He also moderated a roundtable discussion on data access in the DSA era.
description: Reports on Fabio Giglietto's participation in two conferences in Brazil in October 2025, where he presented research on using large language models to analyze political discourse in hyperpartisan Facebook groups and moderated a roundtable discussion on data access.

title: Mapping Italian News Research Program - Uniurb
snippet: This page from the University of Urbino website mentions Fabio Giglietto as part of the Mapping Italian News Research Program. It highlights a white paper co-authored by him and Massimo Terenzi on the DSA and data access, and also mentions his role in the vera.ai project.
description: This page from the University of Urbino details Fabio Giglietto's involvement in the Mapping Italian News Research Program, highlighting his work on the DSA and data access, and his role in the vera.ai project. The content aligns with his expertise in social media research and disinformation studies.

title: THE BRAZILIAN DIGITAL BATTLEFIELD: INVESTIGATING THE DYNAMICS OF POLITICAL INFORMATION CAMPAIGNS IN POST-BOLSONARO ERA | AoIR Selected Papers of Internet Research
snippet: Fabio Giglietto co-authored a study investigating the dynamics of misinformation campaigns on Facebook in Brazil, focusing on the period from the 2022 elections to the aftermath of the attempted coup on January 8, 2023.
description: The selected paper from AoIR discusses a study co-authored by Fabio Giglietto that investigates the dynamics of political information campaigns on Facebook in Brazil, specifically focusing on the period surrounding the 2022 elections and the January 8, 2023, attempted coup.

title: Coordinated Hateful Disinformation on Italian Politics and Social Issues, since 2017
snippet: This ResearchGate entry (dated 2025-08-07) references Giglietto's work on coordinated disinformation since 2017, noting a network including Pages known for spreading harmful false stories since 2017, referencing Giglietto et al., 2021. It also mentions coordinated link-sharing behavior (CLSB) before the 2018 and 2019 Italian elections, a topic he has researched extensively.
description: This ResearchGate entry references Fabio Giglietto's work on coordinated disinformation campaigns since 2017. It discusses research related to coordinated link-sharing behavior before the 2018 and 2019 Italian elections, aligning with his expertise.

title: Home | Professor of Internet Studies
snippet: This is a bio page for Fabio Giglietto, PhD, a Professor of Internet Studies at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo. It highlights his research interests in disinformation, social media analysis, computational social science, and political communication. It mentions his work on coordinated link-sharing behavior during the Italian elections.
description: This is a bio page for Fabio Giglietto, a Professor of Internet Studies at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo, highlighting his research interests in disinformation, social media analysis, and political communication.

title: Coordinated Hateful Disinformation on Italian Politics and Social Issues, since 2017 | Request PDF - ResearchGate
snippet: This ResearchGate entry references Fabio Giglietto's work (Giglietto et al., 2021) on disinformation in the context of COVID-19. It mentions his research on coordinated disinformation campaigns and the use of social media to influence political behavior, particularly concerning Facebook activity before the 2018 and 2019 Italian elections.
description: This ResearchGate entry mentions Fabio Giglietto's research on disinformation related to COVID-19 and Italian elections, specifically referencing his 2021 publication. It discusses his work on coordinated disinformation campaigns and the impact of social media on political behavior.

title: Detection and Characterization of Coordinated Online Behavior: A Survey - arXiv
snippet: This survey paper cites Fabio Giglietto's work on coordinated online behavior, specifically mentioning his 2023 paper with Marino, Mincigrucci, and Stanziano on detecting and monitoring coordinated social media accounts during the 2022 Italian election, as well as Giglietto et al. [2020a].
description: This survey paper cites Fabio Giglietto's research on coordinated online behavior, specifically referencing his 2023 paper on the Italian election and a 2020 paper. It demonstrates the influence of his work within the field of social media analysis.

title: 'Fake news' is the invention of a liar: How false information circulates within the hybrid news system - IRIS
snippet: This entry references Fabio Giglietto's work on 'fake news' and how false information circulates within the hybrid news system. Co-authors include Laura Iannelli, Augusto Valeriani, and Luca Rossi.
description: The entry references Fabio Giglietto's research on 'fake news' and its circulation within the hybrid news system, indicating a third-party mention of his academic work. The co-authors also suggest this is a legitimate research project.

title: Coordinated Link Sharing Behavior as a Signal to Surface Sources of Problematic Information on Facebook | Request PDF - ResearchGate
snippet: This ResearchGate entry discusses Fabio Giglietto's work (Giglietto et al. 2020) on coordinated link-sharing behavior (CLSB) as a signal to surface sources of problematic information on Facebook. It highlights how coordinated networks manipulate visibility and media narratives and how CLSB is associated with higher risks of encountering problematic news sources.
description: This ResearchGate entry references Fabio Giglietto's 2020 work on coordinated link-sharing behavior (CLSB) and its connection to the spread of problematic information on Facebook.

title: POLITICAL ADVERTISEMENT AND COORDINATED BEHAVIOR ON SOCIAL MEDIA IN THE LEAD-UP TO THE 2021 GERMAN FEDERAL ELECTIONS - Landesanstalt für Medien NRW
snippet: This study references Fabio Giglietto's research on Coordinated Link Sharing Behavior (CLSB) and coordinated networks on Facebook, specifically citing 'Giglietto, Righetti, Rossi, & Marino, 2020'. It discusses the use of CLSB to spread anti-establishment narratives and disinformation during elections.
description: This study on political advertisement and coordinated behavior during the 2021 German Federal Elections references Fabio Giglietto's research on Coordinated Link Sharing Behavior (CLSB) and its use in spreading disinformation.

title: Fabio Giglietto
snippet: Fabio Giglietto, PhD, is a distinguished Professor of Internet Studies at the Department of Communication Sciences, Humanities, and International Studies at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo. His research focuses on social media analysis, computational social science, and the detection and analysis of disinformation campaigns, particularly in the context of political communication.
description: The content explicitly mentions Fabio Giglietto as a Professor of Internet Studies at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo, detailing his research focus on social media analysis, computational social science, and disinformation campaigns, aligning with his expertise.

title: Fabio Giglietto
snippet: Mentions Fabio Giglietto's presentation at the XX ISA World Congress of Sociology: 'Understanding Political Crises in the 2020s - a Sociocybernetics Approach' and 'Unintentional Exposure to Political News on Facebook's Religious Pages during the 2022 Italian Election Campaign.'
description: The content mentions Fabio Giglietto's presentation at the XX ISA World Congress of Sociology on topics related to political crises, news exposure on Facebook's religious pages during the 2022 Italian election campaign, aligning with his expertise in social media and political communication.

title: Advancing Research on Disinformation and Digital Manipulation: The University of Urbino at two Key Conferences in Brazil – vera.ai VERification Assisted by Artificial Intelligence

He presented research on using large language models to analyze political discourse in hyperpartisan Facebook groups and co-authored a study on how deceptive information operations evolve. He also moderated a roundtable discussion on data access for social media research in the context of the Digital Services Act.

title: Integrating Large Language Models in Political Discourse Studies on Social Media: Challenges of Validating an LLMs-in-the-loop Pipeline | Sociologica
snippet: Fabio Giglietto is listed as an Associate Professor of Internet Studies at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo, co-authoring a paper on integrating Large Language Models (LLMs) into research workflows for studying political content on social media. The paper discusses a validation protocol for LLM-integrated research, addressing the versatility, granularity, and limitations of LLMs in uncovering narratives. It focuses on challenges in validating a pipeline that classifies political links, clusters them by similarity, and generates descriptive labels, aiming to guide social scientists in employing LLM-based methodologies for political content analysis on social media. Published: 2024-10-30.
description: Fabio Giglietto is listed as an Associate Professor of Internet Studies at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo, co-authoring a paper on integrating Large Language Models (LLMs) into research workflows for studying political content on social media, published in October 2024.

title: PROMPT_whitepaper_The State of Social Media Research APIs & Tools in the Digital Service Act Era - Zenodo
snippet: Fabio Giglietto, along with Massimo Terenzi, authored a white paper from the University of Urbino Carlo Bo, analyzing how the European Union’s Digital Services Act (DSA) is transforming data access for platform research. It draws on existing literature and testing of research APIs/tools from platforms like Meta, YouTube, and TikTok. The paper focuses on Article 40.12, which mandates access to publicly available data, and examines how Very Large Online Platforms (VLOPs) are implementing these requirements, identifying gaps, challenges, and potential solutions. Published: 2024-12-19.
description: Fabio Giglietto co-authored a white paper from the University of Urbino Carlo Bo analyzing the impact of the Digital Services Act (DSA) on data access for platform research, focusing on how VLOPs are implementing Article 40.12 regarding publicly available data.

title: Professor of Internet Studies
snippet: Fabio Giglietto is a Professor of Internet Studies at the Department of Communication Sciences, Humanities, and International Studies at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo. His research focuses on the relationships between social systems, media, and digital technologies, with recent projects focusing on social media analysis, computational social science, and the detection and analysis of disinformation campaigns.

title: A Workflow to Detect, Monitor, and Update Lists of Coordinated Social Media Accounts Across Time - Uniurb
snippet: Fabio Giglietto co-authored a paper on detecting and monitoring coordinated social media accounts, applying a workflow to study the 2022 Italian snap election. The research builds on previous work examining coordinated inauthentic behavior.
